text: <@UE70ED6JV> that error right there is saying that the parameter can’t  greater than 12

:point_up::skin-tone-2: untested… if that doesn’t work then this may be a HubSpot dnd bug
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags/dnd-areas#drag-and-drop-module-code-dnd-module-code-|This hs documentation> says `width` on a `dnd_module` is
> The number of columns occupying the 12 column grid
So they may have goofed by naming the divider module attribute `width`

One workaround if the above code doesn’t work is  try and put the value in a `module_attribute`
Is there a way to put a display condition on a field based on the value of a url or image field?

Quick CTA question: how do you link a CTA to a staged paged? we are working on rolling out a new site and there a bunch of CTA’s that need to be created, but it looks like you can only link to live content, not staged content
I think this is built in protection from linking to staging on a live site.
Thank you guys for your answer and suggestion.
